removals.reasoning: The outer parentheses around the cast expression are redundant in a function-call argument; the cast itself must keep parentheses around the type but the extra pair is unnecessary.
Same as above: the extra outer parentheses around the cast are redundant and can be removed for readability.
The outermost parentheses around the cast chain are unnecessary inside the free() call; keep the necessary cast parentheses but remove the redundant outer pair.
Same as above for this free() call: drop the redundant outer parentheses around the cast expression.
Remove redundant outer parentheses around the cast chain in the free() argument.
Remove the unnecessary outer parentheses around the cast expression used as the free() argument.
Remove the redundant outer parentheses around the cast chain; the inner cast parentheses must remain.

Parentheses around single variables inside casts are unnecessary: (double)(i) -> (double)i and (double)(n) -> (double)n. The outermost parentheses around the whole RHS are also redundant in an assignment.

Keep parentheses that group the numerator (addition) but remove redundant parentheses around single variables inside casts ((double)(i)->(double)i, (double)(n)->(double)n) and the outermost pair around the whole expression.
Same rationale as line 189: remove redundant parentheses around single-variable casts and the unnecessary outermost parentheses while preserving the numerator grouping.
Remove redundant parentheses around the inner casts and the outermost pair; keep the parentheses that ensure the addition happens before division.
Parentheses around the array index are redundant; A[i * n + j] is clearer and equivalent.

Remove parentheses around single-variable casts ((double)(i)->(double)i, (double)(j)->(double)j, (double)(n)->(double)n). Multiplication and division have the same precedence and evaluate left-to-right so extra grouping around the numerator is unnecessary.
The extra parentheses around the partial expression are redundant. Parentheses are still used to group the entire numerator (addition/subtraction) relative to division.
Remove redundant outer parentheses around the entire RHS and the inner parentheses around the array index and multiplication. Operator precedence (+ and *) already yields the intended evaluation.
Same as line 211: outer parentheses and the index parentheses are redundant; expression reads more clearly without them and precedence is preserved.
The outer parentheses around the cast are redundant, and &dim_block256_coerce does not need its own parentheses here. Use the usual (uint8_t*)&dim_block256_coerce form for readability.
Remove redundant parentheses around the cast and the address expression; (uint8_t*)&dim_block256 is clearer and equivalent.
Same cleanup as for dim_block256_coerce: drop redundant parentheses around the cast/address expression.
Remove redundant parentheses around the cast and the & operand to improve readability.
As above: outer parentheses are unnecessary; use the standard cast-to-pointer-of-address form.
Remove redundant parentheses around the cast and address expression for clarity.
Drop the unnecessary outer parentheses around the cast/address expression.
Remove redundant parentheses to simplify the cast-of-address expression.
Parentheses around a single variable passed as an argument are unnecessary and can be removed for clarity.
Same as above: remove redundant parentheses around the format string variable.
The parentheses around the single variable argument to fprintf are redundant and reduce readability.
